channel.title: Just something I thought I'd mention
channel.description:
So, I've been working on making the client class of my Allstar Based server a lot smaller. I'm proud to say that my client class is HALF(at the time of this post 710KB) of Allstar Scapes original 1426KB client class.
I know Allstar sucks but at least it's not PI LOL. :)
539KB.
381KB.
337KB.

item.title: Just something I thought I'd mention
item.dc:creator: @TheLetterQArousesMe TheLetterQArousesMe
item.description:
@TheLetterQArousesMe wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:11, topic:481770”][quote author=TheLetterQArousesMe link=topic=600010.msg4215822#msg4215822 date=1360273087]

I would say this belongs in the development section, but because people are discussing other things appropriate for this board I’ll leave it open.

I’ll keep that in mind next time I decide to post something here. Wasn’t sure if I should put it here or in Development, sorry

Oh and @Clawz mine barely uses process(Graham’s Event Manager) and process runs on a 600ms tick xP
[/quote]
eventmanager sucks create your own event system or use his new taskscheduler :)[/quote]

Implemented taskscheduler. @Jmood cool

Read full topic

item.source: Just something I thought I'd mention

item.title: Just something I thought I'd mention
item.dc:creator: @TheLetterQArousesMe TheLetterQArousesMe
item.description:
@TheLetterQArousesMe wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:5, topic:481770”]you do realize that allstar is 10x worse then PI is terms of stability, right?

The only reason why people bash PI so hard is because the shittiest developers use PI. Nowadays usually people with some sort of common sense and who have been in the rsps scene for awhile use allstar.

Allstar
Standard IO networking
Thread per client model (because of blocking IO)
Huge switch statement to handle packets
Usually rely on manipulating the usage of the process method to perform tasks
Rely on ‘LagHandlers’ lol

Project Insanity
MINA (I’ve also seen netty) networking
Packets are handled in an array/hashmap
Usually have if not just one, multiple task/event systems
Usually have some form of garbage collection (although in some, idiotically implemented…)

So yeah, other than the fact PI has been through the hands of a million shitty developers, it’s not a horrible base. It gets the job done, and can hold a decent amount of players.[/quote]

I was kind of kidding when I said at least it’s not PI. I realize PI is much better XD

Read full topic
item.source: Just something I thought I'd mention

item.title: Just something I thought I'd mention
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

you do realize that allstar is 10x worse then PI is terms of stability, right?

The only reason why people bash PI so hard is because the shittiest developers use PI. Nowadays usually people with some sort of common sense and who have been in the rsps scene for awhile use allstar.

Allstar
Standard IO networking
Thread per client model (because of blocking IO)
Huge switch statement to handle packets
Usually rely on manipulating the usage of the process method to perform tasks
Rely on ‘LagHandlers’ lol

Project Insanity
MINA (I’ve also seen netty) networking
Packets are handled in an array/hashmap
Usually have if not just one, multiple task/event systems
Usually have some form of garbage collection (although in some, idiotically implemented…)

So yeah, other than the fact PI has been through the hands of a million shitty developers, it’s not a horrible base. It gets the job done, and can hold a decent amount of players.

Read full topic
